result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:44 PM Cases called: 22CF856 & 22CF979. Defendant Travis R. Mikkelsen in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Travis R. Mikkelsen.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives time limits for the preliminary hearing in both cases
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/17/22 at 3:15pm
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to operate any motor vehicle.
(Covers 22CF979, 22CF856)

11:10am Cases called; 22CF856 & 22CF979. Defendant Travis Mikkelsen appears in custody via video conference from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. Attorney Monica Fallon appeared for in person for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant executed in both cases. Defendant waives reading of complaint. State requests a $1,500 cash bond. Defense requests a $500 cash bond. Time limits for Preliminary Hearing have not been waived in 22CF979.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cases called at 1:50 PM: 22CF856, 22CF979. 
Defendant Travis R. Mikkelsen not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Travis R. Mikkelsen.  Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrants and notes there are 2 officers subpoenaed to testify today.
Court orders warrants.

Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
